programme.title: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King
programme.sub-title: Action, Fantasy, War, Drama, Sci Fi ║ 2003 ║ 12
programme.desc: The Oscar-winning final part of Peter Jackson's adaptation of JRR Tolkien's fantasy adventure. The hobbit Frodo continues his journey to destroy the ring before the evil Lord Sauron can seize it. programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.sub-title: Action, Fantasy, Romance, Drama, Sci Fi, War ║ 2017 ║ 12
programme.desc: Fantasy action adventure starring Gal Gadot and Chris Pine. Young Diana has been raised a warrior on the secret island of Themyscira, shielded from the perils of the real world. programme.title: Terminator 2: Judgment Day
programme.desc: James Cameron's science-fiction action thriller sequel to The Terminator, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger and Linda Hamilton. Tormented by the imminent threat of a nuclear holocaust from which intelligent machines will emerge to crush the last vestiges of human existence, Sarah Connor has been institutionalised and separated from her son. Informed of the future, she knows that young John Connor will survive and become leader of the human race. programme.title: The Last Samurai
programme.desc: Period action drama, starring Tom Cruise. In 1876, after witnessing the US military brutality against native Americans, Captain Nathan Algren turns to drink to escape his battle nightmares. Hired by the young Japanese emperor to train the country's first modern, conscript army, Algren is forced to lead an inadequate campaign against the ancient line of Japanese warriors, the Samurai. programme.title: The King's Speech
programme.desc: Oscar-winning historical drama starring Colin Firth, Helena Bonham Carter and Geoffrey Rush. As part of his royal duties, Prince Albert is required to speak at public events, a task made all the more difficult owing to his severe stammer. programme.title: Sumotherhood
programme.desc: Riko and best friend Kane bungle the robbery of a local bank, causing one of the customers, hard man Leo Demarco, to suffer a heart attack. programme.desc: A man enlists the help of two sword fighters to seek revenge upon his father's mortal enemy. Directed by John Woo. (1979)(106 mins).

programme.desc: Three brothers visit their highly skilled grandfather for the summer, who trains the boys in his techniques of ninjutsu. Family action comedy. (1992)(84 mins).

programme.sub-title: In a desperate and unjust land, where government corruption rules the day, only one man has the courage to challenge the
programme.desc: Iron Monkey. (1993)(85 mins).

programme.desc: A country boy becomes the head of a gang through the purchase of some lucky roses from an old lady. Jackie Chan stars. In Cantonese with subtitles. (1989)(110 mins).

programme.title: Raging Fire
programme.desc: A successful cop finds his past come back to haunt him when a former protege begins a deadly revenge mission. In Cantonese with subtitles. (2021)(126 mins).

programme.title: Police Story 2
programme.desc: Kevin Chan is demoted from detective to traffic cop just as Hong Kong is hit by a wave of bomb scares. Jackie Chan stars. (1988)(90 mins).

programme.title: The Cinema List: Jackie Chan
programme.desc: From 80s hit Police Story to 2010 blockbuster The Karate Kid, discover some of the most iconic films in Jackie Chan's prolific career. And remember, don't try this at home!

programme.desc: Lewis Hamilton sat down with Martin Brundle to reflect on some magic moments from F1 history ahead of the sport's 70th Anniversary Grand Prix at Silverstone.

programme.title: Indycar Highlights
programme.desc: It's an NTT IndyCar Series race day at the Grand Prix of Long Beach. Last year's race was one to remember for Kyle Kirkwood who became an IndyCar winner for the very first time. (21.04).

programme.title: Ferrari in the Desert
programme.desc: Martin Brundle heads to the Bahrain desert to catch up with Ferrari pair Carlos Sainz and Charles Leclerc ahead of the 2024 season opener.

programme.title: Japanese F1 GP Highlights
programme.desc: The lights go out for the 2024 Japanese Grand Prix. Sergio Perez brought the fight to his Red Bull teammate, but it will be Max Verstappen on pole. Lando Norris starts in P3. (07.04).
